front.title: Problem Statement: DNS Resolution of Aliased Names

abstract.t: This document attempts to describe a set of issues that arises from the desire to treat a set or group of names as "aliases" of each other, "bundled," "variants," or "the same," which is problematic in terms of corresponding behavior for DNS labels and FQDNs. With the emergence of internationalized domain names, among other potential use cases, two or more names that users will regard as having identical meaning may sometimes require corresponding behavior in the underlying infrastructure, possibly in the DNS itself. It's not clear how to accommodate this required behavior of such names in DNS resolution; in particular, it's not clear when they are best accommodated in registry practices for generating names for lookup in the DNS, existing DNS protocol elements and behavior, existing application-layer mechanisms and practices, or some set of protocol elements or behavior not yet defined. This document attempts to describe some of these cases and the behavior of some of the possible solutions discussed to date.
